meanings.definition: Showing a blush or flush of color, especially from embarrassment or shyness.
meanings.sent1: The ablush cheeks of the shy girl revealed her embarrassment.
meanings.sent2: Her face turned ablush when she realized she had made a mistake.
meanings.sent3: The ablush reaction of the boy to the surprise party was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky ablush with vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals were ablush with a delicate pink shade.

meanings.definition: To become red in the face due to embarrassment or shyness.
meanings.sent1: She ablushed when she accidentally bumped into the stranger.
meanings.sent2: He ablushed as he spoke in front of the large audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat ablushed after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The sky ablushed as the sun dipped below the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The child ablushed with guilt after breaking the vase.
